comment: Prof Franklin is truly incredible! Even if you're struggling with the AI assignments, as long as he can see you are actually trying, you won't fail the class. He is always available to chat with on Teams when you have questions and he goes over problems that students are having on the assignments. Grade is based on 6 assignments and a final

Dr. Franklin was a great professor! He really cared about his students and made sure that everyone understood the material. He related everything he taught to the real world to make it interesting and engaging. He was a very easy grader as long as you followed the instructions. although he didn't give much feedback unless you asked him.
Franklin is an amazing professor. He has fantastic lectures and does a great job making sure every last person in the class understands the concepts and projects. He is also an easy grader.

If you can take Dr. Franklin, do it. He is probably the best professor I've ever had. He goes in depth with lectures, is always available to chat about assignments, and is willing to help as much as he possibly can. He's understanding with due dates, and his main focus is ensuring that you're learning, not what grade you get on an assignment. 13/10

This is honestly the worst professor I have ever had. This professor never responds to email and this being an online course is a major problem. For the first week of class, none of the materials could be accessed and the teacher was not responding to emails. The only thing I can say that is positive is that the teacher is an easy grader.

Dr. Franklin is extremely understanding and flexible when it comes to deadlines. Furthermore, he is a very entertaining individual and his lectures are fantastic. However, the standards for our course were set incredibly low- you could turn in garbage and still get an A. Unfortunately, we didn't know this until the end since he was slow to grade.

He was amazing. He loves to tell stories. He actually knows what he is teaching. And he actually teaches. You don't need to stress about anything because odds are, he'll help you. I pretty much understood everything he thought. the only issue I had was he didn't teach much on PHP, or how to download and set up mamps, MySQL, and so on.

Dr. Franklin is definitely my favorite teacher that I have ever had! Don't miss the chance to take one of his classes! He is witty, intelligent, geeky (in the best way), and full of practical knowledge from personal experience. The feedback that he provided was very useful and helped me learn a lot! If you are a devoted student, you will succeed!

Dr. Franklin is one of the most well respected professors in the KSU school of computing for good reason. He is passionate, articulate, and genuinely cares about his student's success. Aside from a distinct lack of creativity regarding economic policy, It's difficult to find things to criticize. Take this professor.

Hands down the best professor at KSU. Lectures are super fun and engaging, homework and projects while difficult are graded fairly and he is always open to help whenever you need it. Have taken a Franklin class every semester since Freshman year. Loved him so much I went back for my masters just to take more of his classes.

Great Teacher who challenges his students to really get out there with their project work. If you want a teacher that will help you learn through projects and is very open when you're a little bit behind then Franklin is perfect. You will need to put in effort to get the A but as long as the effort is visible he notices it and it shows.
This class is alright, but he procrastinates on grading.

Franklin is strict, but very caring and obviously cares about the subject immensely. He also knows his stuff and you'll learn a lot about making games. Projects are tough, but enjoyable to create (you're going to make several board games). My one complaint would be that he procrastinates on grading and you'll often not know what's due and when.

Can't say enough about Dr. Franklin; one of the best at KSU. He is very passionate about the subjects he teaches and that makes for great lectures. You will learn a lot, but you will also work a lot. So don't expect an easy A. Show up to every class, take notes, do the work, and you'll do fine.

Great teacher, class was a lot of fun but you can tell he knows his stuff. He's extremely intelligent but that doesn't mean he's strict. He will work with you on your project grades and he's a lenient grader on tests. Participation and attendance should get you an A. Don't expect to do well if you don't go to class or procrastinate on your projects

So far, Dr. Franklin's Operating System course is the best semester I've spent in college. It was very challenging and the project took a lot of work, but I haven't taken anything else that better demonstrated core CS topics such as concurrency, job scheduling, priority queues, etc. Outstanding lectures, lots of geeky jokes, and a lot of fun.

Great lectures, interesting projects, outstanding teacher. Every semester, I look for classes taught by Professor Franklin first. You will get a first class learning experience and have a lot of fun along the way. Highly recommended.
The best

Professor Franklin has been an amazing professor, so far. He is willing to answer your questions and he is extremely kind a lot of the students attending his class. The one and only downside to his teaching methods is that his lectures can sometimes lead to an off topic class discussion, however, Professor Franklin is still an awesome teacher.

He is amazing. I wanted to go to class every day because he is that awesome.I made databases sound like chocolate. He is also really funny. I wish he could teach everyone of my classes. He made you want to learn sql .

Awesome Professor, The best professor I ever had, he knows what is he teaching. He  shares  his very valuable advice from his  rich experience . He is very respectful and helpful for his students. The course is really hard, but he is the right professor to teach it. I really recommend others to take this course with him.

He's a really enthusiastic teacher, but he gets side tracked a lot. As long as you do the projects, you should get an A in the class. There's only one test, the final, and it's mostly a formality as all the questions are super easy. He doesn't teach as much as I'd like and often goes on long (but interesting) rants about games and movies and such.

Prof Franklin is really a stupendous professor. His lectures are very succinct, intriguing and beefed up with many years of practical industry experience. He has also a sense of humor and he loves his teaching profession. His assignments are challenging  but he is always there to help & inspire you. You will learn a lot from this amazing professor.
Michael Franklin is a class act. He's also a great teacher. You really do need to pay attention, but if you do that, this class will be fun. You'll learn about Unity and scripting in general.

This guy is AWESOME. He's got loads of experience in the computing and game industry and is always willing to give his students tons of advice to help them succeed. You'll have to put in the work to pass in this class, but as long as you listen, be creative and do your best, you're sure to pass. Best teacher I've ever had!

Great lecturer, lots of geek humor, excellent industry experience, flexible if you keep him informed and are clearly working hard to master the material. You always know where you stand with Professor Franklin... he doesn't play any games.

Professor Franklin is a really great teacher and probably the best one I ever had in all my education career. His lectures were always interesting, fun and very engaging. Meeting with him in person for help was always encouraging and he really wanted you to succeed as long as you are willing to put in the work to learn to code yourself.
Great teacher that heavily invests in the students, very open to feedback, and does everything in his power to ensure that the students get the most out of the class and enjoy the experience!

Professor Franklin gives students every opportunity to succeed. His lectures are very interesting and have practical application. Assignments are challenging but doable. I wish I could take him every semester!
